Version: The Targum of Jonathan ben Uzziel, trans. J. W. Etheridge, London, 1862
Content: And thou shalt put olive oil upon it, and lay frankincense thereon; it is a mincha.

Version: The Targum of Jonathan ben Uzziel, trans. J. W. Etheridge, London, 1862
Content: And their minchas of wheat flour, mingled with olive oil, three tenths for each bullock, two tenths for the ram,

Version: The Rashi chumash by Rabbi Shraga Silverstein
Content: And kiddah, five hundred in the shekel-weight of the sanctuary, and a hin of olive oil.

Version: Eliyahu Munk, HaChut Hameshulash
Content: the word שמן refers to oil from olives, olive trees growing primarily in mountainous regions.

Version: Sefaria Community Translation
Content: Isn’t it written in a ברייתא that if you find a cut fish or bitten fish you are required to be declare it? Barrels of wine, olive oil, wheat, figs, and olives may be kept.

Version: The Holy Scriptures: A New Translation (JPS 1917)
Content: And thou shalt command the children of Israel, that they bring unto thee pure olive oil beaten for the light, to cause a lamp to burn continually.

Version: The Targum of Jonathan ben Uzziel, trans. J. W. Etheridge, London, 1862
Content: If he offer it for a thanksgiving let him offer with the oblation of thanks unleavened cakes mingled with olive oil, and unleavened wafers anointed with olive oil, and flour fried with a mixture of olive oil.

Version: William Davidson Edition - English
Content: The Sages interpreted: A land of olive oil and honey, as: A land, all of whose measures are olive-bulks. The Gemara poses a question: Does it enter your mind that it is a land all of whose measures

Version: The Targum of Jonathan ben Uzziel, trans. J. W. Etheridge, London, 1862
Content: and a basket of unleavened cakes of flour with olive oil, and unleavened wafers anointed with olive oil, their minchas and libations.

Version: The Targum of Jonathan ben Uzziel, trans. J. W. Etheridge, London, 1862
Content: and their mincha of wheaten flour mingled with olive oil, three tenths for the bullock, two tenths for the ram,

Version: The Targum of Jonathan ben Uzziel, trans. J. W. Etheridge, London, 1862
Content: And on the eighth day let him take two lambs unblemished, and one ewe lamb of the year unblemished; and three-tenths of flour for the mincha mingled with olive oil, and one log of olive oil.

Version: Sefaria Community Translation
Content: the purest olive oil: for if the menorah, whose [oil] is not for eating, requires pure olive oil, then should not grain offerings, whose oil is for eating, also require pure olive oil? But Scripture

Version: William Davidson Edition - English
Content: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: All the oils are suitable for the Hanukkah lamp, and olive oil is the most select of the oils. Abaye said: At first, my Master, Rabba, would seek sesame oil, as he said

Version: Sefaria Community Translation
Content: Paragraph 1 — All oils and wicks are fit for use for the Hanukkah light, even if the oils are not drawn after the wick, and the illumination is not held well by those wicks. Rema: However, olive oil

Version: Pentateuch with Rashi's commentary by M. Rosenbaum and A.M. Silbermann
Content: זית שמן (lit., the olive of oil) means, olives that produce oil (i.e. good olives, not hard fruits that give no oil).

Version: Eliyahu Munk, HaChut Hameshulash
Content: ולשמן המשחה, the hin of pure olive oil.

Version: The Targum of Jonathan ben Uzziel, trans. J. W. Etheridge, London, 1862
Content: and unleavened bread, and unleavened cakes, mingled with olive oil; and wafers of unleavened bread anointed with olive oil, and with flour of wheat shalt thou make them.

Version: Pentateuch with Rashi's commentary by M. Rosenbaum and A.M. Silbermann
Content: שמן למאר OIL FOR THE LIGHT — “clear olive-oil … to make the flame ascend continually”).

Version: Open Mishnah
Content: oil, radish [seed] oil, fish oil, gourd [seed] oil, tar, and naphtha. Rabbi Tarfon says: One may only light olive oil.

Version: The Rashi chumash by Rabbi Shraga Silverstein
Content: Olive trees will you have in all of your borders, but with oil shall you not anoint yourself, for your olive tree will cast off [its fruits].

Version: The Holy Scriptures: A New Translation (JPS 1917)
Content: ’Command the children of Israel, that they bring unto thee pure olive oil beaten for the light, to cause a lamp to burn continually.

Version: Chizkuni, translated and annotated by Eliyahu Munk
Content: יערוך אותו, “he is to arrange it.” (the olive oil)

Version: The Rashi chumash by Rabbi Shraga Silverstein
Content: A land of wheat, barley, grapevine, fig, and pomegranate; a land of olive-oil and honey.
